incidents.name: Google social login option is not working

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We see metrics go back on our side and Google authentication works now. We will monitor it for a while.
There is performance degradation on Google side and major ISPs in the US are also affected: Verizon, AT&T, and T-Mobile
Google social login option is not working because of Google outage

incidents.name: CVE-2024-23748 - Electron vulnerability

incident_updates.body:
We want to provide an update on the recently reported CVE-2024-23748, a vulnerability which relates to certain configurations of the ElectronJS framework and has the potential to impact a number of applications, including Miro. 

The security of our users and our product is critically important to us here at Miro, and we take these reports seriously. We have thoroughly researched the potential impact of this vulnerability on the Miro client to clearly understand any exposure it might create. Based on our investigations, we believe that the potential impact is not as severe as reported. We have found an attacker must already have the ability to run applications on a user’s computer to potentially execute code in the context of the Miro application as also clarified in ElectronsJS blog post describing the underlying vulnerability. We have addressed this vulnerability by releasing an updated, patched version of the Miro macOS application.

We strongly encourage users to update to the latest version (0.8.39), which contains the patch for this vulnerability. Most users will receive the update automatically through a restart, but enterprises who centrally manage and distribute their updates will need to proactively update to the latest version.

Additionally, based on our investigation, we believe that the statement from the NVD [1] that this is Remote Code Execution (RCE) is incorrect, as an attacker requires local access to the user’s machine in order to execute this attack. Using a standard CVSS calculation, we consider the rating for this vulnerability to be a Medium. Miro has since contacted the NVD to dispute the accuracy and completeness of the information published. 


Resources

[1] Miro CVE - https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-23746
[2] Official Electron statement - https://www.electronjs.org/blog/statement-run-as-node-cves

incidents.name: Miro Degraded

incident_updates.body: On Dec 4th from 14:10 UTC to 18:32 UTC Miro faced a degradation across core services, which appeared as latency or an inability to access the core product. Starting at 19:00 UTC and ending 21:03 emergency maintenance was undertaken after which service was restored. We will continue to monitor system performance and stability. The RCA will be shared when it is available. We apologize for any inconvenience this situation may have caused and thank you again for your patience.
From 2:02 - 2:18 UTC time, users may have experienced intermittent delays in loading Miro Boards and Dashboards. We will continue to monitor the situation. We will provide updates as necessary.

Service has been restored. We will continue to monitor system performance and stability. We do not plan to provide an additional update, but will share the RCA when it is available. We apologize for any inconvenience this situation may have caused and thank you again for your patience.

Emergency maintenance is still underway.  We are in the process of bringing our systems back online. We are slowly allowing traffic onto the platform and we will continue to monitor the situation. The next update will be in 30 minutes or sooner. Thank you for your patience.

Emergency maintenance is still underway. We estimate this will take another ~30 minutes. While we continue to investigate the root cause, this service degradation does not impact data, although work done during this period may be impacted. The next update will be in 30 minutes or sooner. We continue to thank you for your patience.

Emergency maintenance is still underway. We are working to bring our systems back online as soon as possible. While we continue to investigate the root cause, this service degradation does not impact data, although work done during this period may be impacted. The next update will be in 30 minutes or sooner. We continue to thank you for your patience.

As a part of our efforts to restore service, we are undergoing emergency maintenance. The maintenance began at approximately 1PM CST and we estimate it will take at least 60 minutes. During this time, Miro will be completely unavailable. We apologize for the inconvenience this may cause and thank you for your patience.

Miro is facing a degradation across core services, which may appear as latency or an inability to access the core product. We are working to restore the service as soon as possible and will share an RCA once available. The next update will be in 30 minutes or sooner. Thank you for your patience.
